skill.name: frontend-design
skill.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill when the user asks to build web components, pages, or applications. Generates creative, polished code that avoids generic AI aesthetics.

security_audit.summary: This is an OFFICIAL Anthropic skill containing only instructional content with no executable code, file operations, or external API calls. No security concerns identified.

content.value_statement: Creates distinctive, production-grade web interfaces with exceptional aesthetic quality that avoid generic AI-generated designs through bold, intentional creative choices.
actual_capabilities: Generates production-grade HTML/CSS/JS, React, Vue, and other framework code
Creates bold, distinctive aesthetic directions tailored to project context
Implements sophisticated typography with unique font pairings
Designs cohesive color schemes using CSS variables
Adds animations and micro-interactions using CSS and Motion libraries
Creates unexpected layouts with asymmetry, overlap, and spatial composition
Implements atmospheric backgrounds with gradients, textures, and visual effects
Ensures code quality matches aesthetic vision (elaborate for maximalist, refined for minimalist)
Avoids generic AI aesthetics like Inter/Roboto fonts and purple gradients
limitations: Requires user to provide frontend requirements and context
Focuses on aesthetic and design quality over backend functionality
Does not handle backend logic, databases, or API integration
Best suited for greenfield projects rather than retrofitting existing designs

use_cases.target_user: Startup founders, marketing teams, product designers

use_cases.title: React Component Library
use_cases.description: Build a cohesive set of production-grade React components with distinctive aesthetic choices, animations, and consistent design system

use_cases.title: Portfolio Website
use_cases.description: Design a memorable portfolio site with creative layouts, unique typography, and sophisticated interactions that showcase work in an unforgettable way

use_cases.title: Dashboard Interface
use_cases.description: Create a functional yet visually refined dashboard that breaks away from generic admin templates with intentional aesthetic choices
use_cases.target_user: Product teams, SaaS founders, enterprise developers

prompt_templates.title: Component with Aesthetic Direction
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a [component type] with a [aesthetic direction] aesthetic for [purpose]. Target audience is [audience]. Make it feel [adjective] and memorable.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have a clear vision for the design tone and want to communicate it explicitly

prompt_templates.title: Open-Ended Creative Brief
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [page/component] for [purpose/product]. The audience is [description]. Surprise me with something distinctive and production-ready.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you want the AI to make bold creative choices based on context

prompt_templates.title: Framework-Specific Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a [component] in [React/Vue/vanilla JS] with [specific features]. Use [animation library] for interactions. Style should be [aesthetic description].
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have technical requirements and framework preferences

prompt_templates.title: Redesign with Constraints
prompt_templates.prompt: Redesign this [existing interface] to be more [adjective]. Keep the functionality but make it visually unforgettable. Technical constraints: [list constraints].
prompt_templates.scenario: When improving an existing interface within specific limitations

output_examples.input: Build a pricing page for a developer tool with a brutalist aesthetic
output_examples.output: Production React code with monospace fonts (JetBrains Mono, Courier), stark black/white/red color scheme, asymmetric grid layout, raw HTML table elements, pixelated borders, and terminal-inspired animations

output_examples.input: Create a hero section for a wellness app targeting millennials
output_examples.output: HTML/CSS with organic flowing shapes, soft pastel gradients (sage, lavender, cream), paired fonts (Fraunces display + Spectral body), subtle parallax scrolling, breathing animations, and generous whitespace

best_practices: Provide clear context about purpose, audience, and technical constraints
Specify aesthetic direction if you have a vision (brutalist, maximalist, minimal, etc.)
Mention framework preferences (React, Vue, vanilla) and animation libraries upfront
Request both functional code and visual polish together
Ask for production-grade code to get proper structure and best practices
Be open to unexpected creative choices that match your context
Specify accessibility requirements if critical to your project
anti_patterns: Asking for 'clean and modern' without more specific direction (leads to generic results)
Requesting multiple contradictory aesthetics in one design
Expecting backend functionality or API integration from frontend-focused skill
Providing no context about purpose or audience
Asking to copy existing popular sites exactly (defeats the distinctive design purpose)
Requesting minimal aesthetic but expecting elaborate animations (mismatched complexity)

faq.question: What frameworks and technologies does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill generates code for HTML/CSS/JS, React, Vue, and other major frontend frameworks. It can adapt to your specified tech stack and will use appropriate animation libraries like Framer Motion for React.

faq.question: Will the generated designs be accessible?
faq.answer: While the skill focuses on aesthetic quality, it generates production-grade code. For critical accessibility requirements, explicitly mention them in your request to ensure proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and contrast ratios.

faq.question: How do I avoid getting generic-looking designs?
faq.answer: Provide context about your project's purpose and audience. The skill is specifically designed to avoid generic aesthetics, but richer context enables more distinctive, contextually-appropriate creative choices.

faq.question: Can I specify exact colors and fonts, or should I let it choose?
faq.answer: Both approaches work. You can specify exact design tokens if you have a design system, or provide aesthetic direction and let the skill make bold creative choices. Avoid generic choices like 'use Inter font' unless required by existing brand guidelines.

faq.question: What's the difference between maximalist and minimalist approaches?
faq.answer: Both can be distinctive. Maximalist designs use elaborate code with extensive animations, overlapping elements, and rich visual details. Minimalist designs require precise spacing, refined typography, and subtle micro-interactions. The key is intentionality and execution quality, not complexity level.

faq.question: Is this suitable for enterprise/corporate projects?
faq.answer: Yes, but frame your request appropriately. Enterprise projects can still have distinctive, refined aesthetics within professional constraints. Mention any brand guidelines, accessibility requirements, or technical limitations upfront.
